intro: Linnaea mexicana, commonly known as Mexican twinflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant produces two small, oval-shaped leaves that are opposite on the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest understories. Linnaea mexicana is known for its delicate appearance and is often found growing in clusters along the forest floor.
